Can the sonic shifting gearbox uses neos can’t find anything on this

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-03-13T21:04:31.430Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":132,"readers_count":131,"score":56.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":430124,"topic_slug":"can-sonic-shifters-gearbox-uses-neos","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57952,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/can-sonic-shifters-gearbox-uses-neos/430124/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3163898,"name":"Troy Dietz","username":"troy_dietz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/troy_dietz/{size}/135768_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-13T21:13:30.071Z","cooked":"
thegravitor:

sonic shifting gearbox

A NEO will work almost anywhere a CIM motor would, and the exceptions are due to how the wires route out the side rather than the back of the motor.

Looks like you should good to go.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-03-13T21:13:30.071Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":128,"readers_count":127,"score":25.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":430124,"topic_slug":"can-sonic-shifters-gearbox-uses-neos","display_username":"Troy Dietz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26760,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"❤️ conflict-free COTS"},"post_url":"/t/can-sonic-shifters-gearbox-uses-neos/430124/2","custom_user_title":"❤️ conflict-free COTS","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3163909,"name":"hrench","username":"hrench","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hrench/{size}/5972_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-13T21:30:07.766Z","cooked":"

The low-speed torque of brushless motors pretty much negates the value provided by shifting gearboxes.

The complexity of the shifters and their high failure rate wasn’t fun either.

And shifting gearbox implies tank drive. If you want to win, tank drive isn’t the path I’d recommend.

Do you have any recommendations on fast but also with torque for defense

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-03-13T21:35:18.201Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":86,"readers_count":85,"score":32.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":430124,"topic_slug":"can-sonic-shifters-gearbox-uses-neos","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":17877,"username":"hrench","name":"hrench","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hrench/{size}/5972_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57952,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/can-sonic-shifters-gearbox-uses-neos/430124/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3163941,"name":"hrench","username":"hrench","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hrench/{size}/5972_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-13T21:55:22.330Z","cooked":"

seeing that last year we used four Neos on the Andymark AM14U kit (with one-speed tough-box mini transmissions) and were as fast as even the best swerve drives because we kept weight lower (under 100 lbs). If you’re on a budget, I’d just do that.

This year we’ve used the Rev swerve modules. Really this game is just better with swerve. In Oklahoma this week, the Rev modules kept our robot’s mobility at the top of the game. Here is a video of 1108 just flat outrunning our amazing teammate 6424, who has SDS swerve modules. top right, blue robots.

Our Rev modules are using the ‘high speed’ pinion and our robot weighs 75 lbs.
And they cost less than SDS.

Is the speed tough-box mini transmissions just the starter kit gear box

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-03-13T22:19:13.645Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":68,"readers_count":67,"score":18.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":430124,"topic_slug":"can-sonic-shifters-gearbox-uses-neos","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":17877,"username":"hrench","name":"hrench","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hrench/{size}/5972_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57952,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/can-sonic-shifters-gearbox-uses-neos/430124/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3163975,"name":"hrench","username":"hrench","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hrench/{size}/5972_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-13T22:46:28.069Z","cooked":"

Yes, but also note you can upgrade the gears for it through Andymark. There’s never been a time when we’ve used a tough box mini didn’t get a faster set of gears.

What gear ratio because we are using the same kind of gear box but are pretty slow with the same motors

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-03-13T23:02:54.501Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":56,"readers_count":55,"score":16.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":430124,"topic_slug":"can-sonic-shifters-gearbox-uses-neos","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":17877,"username":"hrench","name":"hrench","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hrench/{size}/5972_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57952,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/can-sonic-shifters-gearbox-uses-neos/430124/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3164302,"name":"hrench","username":"hrench","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hrench/{size}/5972_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-14T12:41:02.208Z","cooked":"

The AM14U-5 ships with 8:45 gears. They’re not terrible, but you’ll do better with faster, depending on your weight. A lighter robot (80-90 lbs) will do good with the 7:31 ratio with Neos. I’m only going to make a recommendation. This is something you should test out and decide…but it is March…you probably should’ve worked this out earlier.

image771×780 46.5 KB

Here’s the Andymark’s toughbox options page link: ToughBox Mini S - AndyMark, Inc)%20Ratio=7.31%3A1&quantity=1
